name: Williamsburg Lodge-Colonial Williamsburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located at the heart of colonial Williamsburg.
reviews.title: Great location in Colonial Williamsburg

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there for the weekend of our anniversary. The hotel has free parking and is steps away from the main sightseeing attractions and restaurants. Once you park your car, you won't need it anymore.
reviews.title: Not what it appears

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have any meals at the hotel restaurant, so I cannot give an opinion about their food. We used their bar though, and the service was good. The hotel lobby is nice and well maintained. The bedroom was spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was okay.
reviews.title: Attention to Detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From my research and experience with this hotel, it seems it is one of the best options in Wiliamsburg.
reviews.title: a very good resort hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We, a party of 14, booked our trip through AAA to avoid any unexpected problems. However, during check-in we had our first unpleasant experience. We were met with an additional $80.00 charge per room (3 rooms) that we did not expect. Even after we showed the staff all the paper work from AAA showing that everything was included and paid for, there was nothing they could or would do. The next surprise came when we picked up our Williamsburg/Busch Gardens passes and found they were also incorrect. Again we showed the staff our paper work from AAA to get this taken care of. Our next experience came during check-out time when we were charged for each breakfast, which was included as part of the package purchased. After talking to the staff once again and showing all our paper work from AAA, they did remove the charges. Our next experience came after we returned home. We discovered that the hotel had once again charged our credit card for the 3 rooms. Only after we called and talked once again to the staff did they agree to remove the charges. We contacted AAA about the first additonal charge for each room and found out that the hotel should not have added any additonal charges. AAA had emails and invoices showing the total which was due and paid by us to AAA with no balance due. The rooms showed their age, carpet worn, TV old, room not fresh smelling and paint peeling off the bath room ceiling. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: A Wonderful, Relaxing Weekend That is Always First Class

reviews.text: I just returned from 2 nights at the Lodge. I was in the newer building. They have a special going on for $ 129. night including a historic pass ( might be winter rates). I got $ 20 bucks off that for being a supporter of CWF! You really cant beat that deal! It is close to the hotels spa and, and historic area. The Friday night seafood buffet was very good. The staff all seemed to be friendly to me. The room was nice sized and very comfortable, the bath large clean and with nice ammenities. I am glad I stayed there, and didn't have to move my car until it was time to go. I would recommend this to any traveler to WIlliamsburg, especially at that price. I had not been there in 12 years, and the Historic Site gets better and better, What great atmosphere. Those that say it is "Disneyfied", don't know what they are talking about. You can't have millions of visitor a year without some "disneyfication" to keep thing organized.
reviews.title: Very Nice experience

reviews.text: Great location for a Williamsburg trip but its not what it used to be. To begin with the service is awful. There were mistakes with my reservation that never got fixed even upon checkout! And the staff was annoyed with me for making a fuss over it. (I was being DOUBLE charged!!!) The powers that be decided to close the 18th century dining pubs with no notice to guests. They claimed it was bc of the economy but every restaurant we tried to get into had a wait. Ridiculous.Please call before you leave to see if these restaurants are open- they make the whole experience authentic. I just got a bad feeling about the place after they did that. Also ,one night we dined at the Inn . It has really gone down hill. A $600 for 4 and we had to flag down the wait staff like we were at Chilis.It was fine dining now its overpriced dining.
reviews.title: Call ahead

reviews.text: The day before leaving for the Lodge I read all 60 reviews. It made me nervous a little but I vowed to post our experience. Here is the brutal truth about our family's experience. We stayed in the South Guesthouse for 2 nights, ajoining rooms. Yes, the floors creaked. We didn't care. Yes, the bathroom was small. It was clean and functional though. The rocking chairs in the rooms were cool. The electric thermostat was great. The friendlliness of the staff at the hotel was hit and miss. The front desk people were very helpful. Ms. Shaft was very good. We got a little run-around about changing tickets for a show but Judy at the hotel's ticket office was great. She took care of everything for us. She was able to book a carriage ride for us. In the past folks had to go into the park to book those. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was so-so. The restaurant's staff were the least friendly during our stay. My wife was angered by their indifference to us. I didn't care so much until I poured a small carton of milk on my cereal that was 9 days past due. Chunks came out! When I checked, other milks were a day past due. Unacceptable. Our server said she'd show the kitchen what they did. I wish I showed a manager instead. Richmond Road has several restaurants within minutes which I recommend over the hotel resaurant. Based on the location, room, and service we would stay at the Lodge again without hesitation. We will not eat at the restaurant again however.
reviews.title: Great trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came for the Grand Illumination with my husband..booked online at www.ColonialWilliamsburg.com. Upon checking in, the utterly disinterested clerk had the correct name but all other info was wrong. So I went to the business center and printed out my confirmation. "Oh. That's not one of our confirmation numbers." He asked if we booked it on a hotel site; yes, I said, the Colonial Williamsburg website. He was not, shall we say, oriented to excellent customer service. I had to tell him to FIGURE IT OUT.
reviews.title: Deeply Disappointed

reviews.text: I can see that others who have stayed here have had good rooms. Keep this in mind: you must avoid the "standard" $250 room and, above all, make sure you are not placed in the South Guest Rooms. They are essentially DORM ROOMS with no insulation or soundproofing--a sad surprise after a long renovation of the property. A slab of drywall is all that separates these rooms and, although charming, the bathroom is the size of a postage stamp. You can hear the people in the next room having a normal conversation and doing what people do in hotel rooms. If you have extremely quiet neighbors, you will thank your lucky stars, but no one is *that* quiet. Needless to say, the time prior to sleep and the early morning are as noisy as...well, as a dorm. Absolutely unacceptable for the price and I'm still astonished as I write this. I've never stayed in any hotel this noisy--not even a Motel 6! I complained and was credited some money, but this is outrageous. We will NEVER stay here again. What a disappointment for something I planned in June and was so looking forward to. We’ll try for the Williamsburg Inn next year, which is older and most likely better built.
reviews.title: Great holiday fun!

reviews.text: We picked Williamsburg Lodge because it was part of Colonial Wiliamsburg, but it was definitely not a deluxe hotel. The guestrooms were FILTHY! I actually cleaned the bathroom myself with baby wipes the first night we were there, but could not seem to get the coffee and other stains out. There was also endless dust on all the furniture that was never cleaned during our three night stay. The room was supposed to be renovated, but did not seem to appear in good shape, other than new carpetting. The bed also did not have fitted s heets, so there were nights were I woke to see my kids under a mattress pad! I do not recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Not worth the money of a deluxe hotel-terrible guest rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a weekend trip to the Williamsburg Lodge and are still raving about our stay. From check-in on Friday to check-out on Sunday morning, everything was perfect. We tried the Friday night Seafood buffet. This is a MUST!! They have a great duo in the lounge on Sat night, named "Me and Jo," with light fare and drinks available.
reviews.title: Great food, Wonderful staff, spotless rooms

reviews.text: We finished the weekend with a delicious Sunday buffet before departing. All staff were courteous, exceptionally friendly, and made us feel at home.
reviews.title: Just say no

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the new guest houses, the rooms are spacious and clean, a nice plus is the full size coffee pot, complimentary newspapers are available at the front desk.
reviews.title: Liked the cozy atmosphere

reviews.text: My husband, our two teenage children, and I stayed at the Williamsburg Lodge for a family Christmas holiday. The room was disappointing. Much smaller and "hotel-like" than portrayed online. The staff at the front desk were horribly rude, inconsiderate, unhelpful, etc., etc. When we arrived, my daughter and I had booked a tea at Ms. Campbells Tavern, and we made the horrible decision to ask at the front desk for directions. The desk staff couldn't be bothered to stop leaning on the back counter long enough to give us any help. It was just "I don't know" and "I think it's at the Inn (Williamsburg Inn) across the street." Yeah... not quite LOSERS... it was at the Ms. Campbells Tavern. Funny thing, that...
reviews.title: Last Time We will Stay Here

reviews.text: I was booked here (at another's expense) for a meeting at the National Center for State Courts. The location was fantastic. Just two blocks from Old Colonial Williamsburg, about 3-4 blocks from the square with shops and great restaurants (Fat Canary is pricey but as good as it get...4 Diamond Winner), and only about 3-4 blocks from Wiliam and Mary.
reviews.title: Not Bad and Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: I can best describe the hotel as a typical business hotel, but with the full style of Colonial Williamsburg. The old Federal brick style is all over the place, the Bar is charming, wooden, makes you feel you are at an old Tavern (and the drinks are great! Stiff), the breakfast menu is really neat and tempting for this poor guy on a diet. Like most biz hotels it had a full breakfast buffet, but also interesting menu items to strike the tourist like the Hunt breakfast that was more of a Virginia ham style eggs benedict (great though!). Wish they had a crab benedict given the close proximity to the Bay. Also, great dinner menu (but I didn't eat there...go to the Fat Canary if you want to blow a similar amount of money (maybe slightly more).
reviews.title: Poorly Managed

reviews.text: Rooms were, well, again biz hotel quality (eh!) but with some trimmings of the colonial with some folk art repos on the wall, pictures of old colonial historical figures in the halls, antique-like decor, and names of buildings with rooms based on historical figures. So it is touristy, yes, but campy, no. Great bath and good bed, good cable, and "nicer" shower shampoos and soaps.
reviews.title: Great location, but dated.

reviews.text: The price that my poor colleagues paid (biz fare I am sure) was a bit much for the experience I had, but I would stay here again. Given location, bar, friendly staff, and that is seems consistent.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, so close to all activities in Colonial Williamsburg

reviews.text: We originally had a reservation at the Woodlands, but they could not accommodate our request for a rollaway which we requested at months earlier. They never mentioned this to us. Did not help us until I asked who to write to about this situation. We were transferred to the Williamsburg Lodge at 9:30 PM.
reviews.title: Relaxing, convenient, luxurious, comfortable--even w/two young kids!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a night last weekend at the Williamsburg Lodge. We found the hotel to be perfect for a weekend getaway. Unfortunately, we only had one night, but wish we could have stayed longer. The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable, and wow the pillows were excellent. The good thing about this hotel is that it centrally located to the historic area. Oh, we enjoyed strolling down DOG street and being able to quickly return to the hotel for a good nights rest. Especially here at Fall time. By the way, breakfast was great too, We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A Splendid Night in Williamsburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend trip to Williamsburg to celebrate our wedding anniversary. While we've been to Williamsburg multiple times, we'd never stayed at the Lodge before. Based on this stay, we may upgrade to the Lodge again from our usual place (Williamsburg Woodlands). We stayed in a suite in the main building. All we had to do was take the stairs (or elevator) from the lobby to be at our room (# 4111). There were two rooms: one with sleeper sofa, desk, sink, fridge, coffee maker, tv, and a couple of chairs; and the bedroom which had a large walk-in closet, tv in armoir, a chair, and a queen bed. The room looked newly refurbished and was probably the cleanest hotel room I've ever stayed int. The bathroom in particular was spotless. Once I spilled lotion on the floor and wiped it up with a washcloth. The washcloth didn't pick up so much as a speck from the floor. The room has wood flooring instead of carpet, which I found that I liked. It, too, was very clean, and I enjoyed walking around barefoot and feeling a clean floor. (I'm paranoid about hotel carpet and never walk barefoot on it.) The bed wasn't the most comfy one in the world. The bed is quite high, which wasn't a problem for us since we're tall, but I wondered if a short person or an elderly person would have trouble climbing up into it or getting out of it. (If we sat on the edge of the bed, our feet hung a few inches off the floor.) The mattress was a bit too firm for us, and the woven coverlet was too heavy to sleep comfortably under, but there were extra pillows and blankets in the closet, so that wasn't a big problem. The bathroom had a wonderful shower and a large double vanity as well as fluffy bathrobes for us to use. We ate in the Lodge restaurant for breakfast every morning. The buffet was included in our package, but otherwise was about $15 a person. The service was excellent and the buffet was great with lots of choices including fruit, yogurt, breakfast meats, and custom omelettes. We had the seafood buffet for dinner one night, and it was also quite good. Nightly turndown service with the little chocolate on the pillow was nice, and the housekeeping service was always great.Overall I'd say the Lodge is much nicer than the Woodlands in that the location is better, the restaurant is nice (there's also a bar that serves food), and the service is better to make the higher price worth it for most people. Those with kids or just hunting a bargain might still like the Woodlands for its homey atmosphere and free breakfast buffet, but the Lodge is a slightly more upscale option.
reviews.title: Spotless Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by a friendly doorman as we entered the hotel lobby. We were taken care of quickly at the front desk upon check-in.
reviews.title: A very charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was in the Nicholas building across the walkway from the main building. Our room was spectacular! Great furnishings and a very comfortable bed! It was a very cozy and comfortable room. The bathroom was very clean and the sink and shower worked great.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: The restaurant was very good. Our package included the breakfast and the food was very good.
reviews.title: Thoroughly Disappointing

reviews.text: My family just recently stayed here for the Thanksgiving Holiday. I have to say that this was one of the best vacations we have ever had and this place is great. Our rooms were large, extremely clean and the housekeeping staff were very nice. The check in and check out at the desk was quick and the staff at the desk could not have been more helpful. When I asked for directions to get gas and then access I-64 to get back home - they provided two maps and I easily got to these locations. Judy at the Concierge window was fantastic. We got tickets to all the evening events we were interested in and nothing was too impossible for this woman. She was a true delight. We only ate breakfast there and I would highly recommend the "all you can eat" buffet bar for $15. It is a real value. What I liked most about this place is the proximity to Historical Duke of Glouster Street. It is 2 blocks away and a quick walk from the Lodge which we did often. And when we were running late - we could ask the doorman to take us over in the free shuttle bus which they did without a problem. The Lodge bar is really nice with a large fireplace and comfortable seating. My family is now all adult - so we sat and drank alcohol and played Monopoly or Clue in front of the fireplace all night after dinner when we returned from our day Historical romp. It was really a great time and we will be back next year.
reviews.title: Geat Experience - Will be back next year

reviews.text: let's just call it colonial disney world. This is what disney would have been in 1776. If you don't mind paying for overpriced meals and overpriced food then go on. This is truly a fantastic trip through history but I may have been better off building a time machine. i reccommend staying off property and bringing your own food and beverage.
reviews.title: Colonial Disney World

reviews.text: The lodge is an expansive property centrally located in historic Williamsburg. The room was spacious and well furnished, and the staff were attentive and friendly.
reviews.title: Nice, but not fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But for the price, I expected a greater attention to detail, and a higher degree of excellence.
reviews.title: Not Worth the Price Tag

likes.disliked: — Room quality did not fit the price

reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: 1. Skip the restaurant. Everything sits under heat lamps, the meat was dry, and the kitchen was uninterested in esthetic presentation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had requested a quiet room away from noises such as street and elevators but were given a room right on the street ! Once we were given a new room (which took a while), the rest of the stay went well as the location is great and the staff, other than the bad start, was very nice. The most negative part of the Lodge is the restaurant as quality of both food and service at dinner is poor for such a high-end place.
reviews.title: Avoid Restaurant

reviews.text: The Williamsburg Lodge is Part of the Colonial Williamsburg Fdn. hospitality group. It is very conveniently located to Colonial Williamsburg and the staff were lovely. However, the rooms are about the quality of a Quality Inn or Comfort Inn - for 2-3 times the price. Bathrooms are old and they were not as clean as I would have liked (hair in the tub). Beds are hard, as are the pillows. We stayed here as a part of a large group, otherwise I would have gone elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great location - way overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we pulled up to the door we felt the warmth and welcoming hospitality of this hotel. The bell men's friendly inquiring of our trip was not rehearsed but sincere.
reviews.title: Superb and Friendly Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff efficiently, yet frienly and professionally, checked us in, providing clear and understandable directions to our room. They were ready for us and happy to have us as their guests.
reviews.title: Great location away from the madding crowd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is welcoming and warm, decoreated with true period furnishings.
reviews.title: Totally dissapointed-not good value for money
Three perfect days in Williamsburg
reviews.text: Loved our visit to the historic area. Weather was perfect. The Lodge was absolutely beautiful. We stayed in their simple queen room -- very clean and well located. The Autumn Stories package was a great deal. I would strongly recommend these deals that include breakfast at the Lodge. The breakfast buffet was above average and their dining room was lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of three museum tours and an archeological walk. Visitors should study the "This Week in Williamsburg" brochure and make reservations at the concierge or the Lumber House. We especially enjoyed "Order in the Court" which was an interactive trial. the concert at the Governor's Palace by candlelight was exquisite.
reviews.title: Stay right in town in a property owned by the Historic Foundation

reviews.text: Dinner at Christiana Campbell's Tavern was superb. I will try to replicate their spoonbread at home!
reviews.title: Very comfortable and interesting place.

reviews.text: Williamsburg is clean, classy, fascinating, romantic, inspiring -- we just loved it.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Lodge experience at Colonial Williamsburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lodge is not as snooty as the Inn (where the Queen stayed) but the best choice in the area for couples who are more interested in the historic area than Busch Gardens. It has a good restaurant and bar, gist shop and underground parking. The profits go to the up-keep of the historic area. Don not stay at one of the many off-site hotles/motels unless you are on a ral budget and have a bunch of kids. The Lodge is THE place to stay and they have a bus that takes you to Yorktown and Jamestown too.
reviews.title: An Unexpected Surprise when we stayed at the Lodge"

description: Modern lodging located on-site in Colonial Williamsburg.
